website_summaries.verdict: Microsoft's new Arc Touch Mouse features a travel-friendly design and some clever technical additions to its touch-sensitive scroll tab. Neither of those features makes it better than a full-size desktop mouse, but the Arc Touch Mouse is different enough in its form and in some of its functions that it should appeal to people looking to make a statement with their technology.
pros: Distinct convertible design lets you pack the mouse flat for travel
touch-sensitive scroll tab has vibration feedback and accelerated scrolling features
BlueTrack sensor lets you use the mouse on a variety of surfaces
small USB receiver stays out of the way when plugged in
cons: lacks heft compared with standard desktop mice

customer_reviews.title: A big mouse in a small package
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a small thin mouse to carry when I travel yet was also hoping to find one that functioned like the real thing I have sitting back at my desk. I imagine that people buy this mouse for any number of reasons, but this was what I was looking for when I purchased this device several weeks ago and I have been pleased with it ever since. When I saw a co-worker using one, and watched him "turn it on" by bending the mouse, I was hooked. Then when I realized how thin it was and how it was what I was looking for as a travel mouse, I was doubly hooked.
customer_reviews.author: mcp

customer_reviews.title: A neat design for a mouse
customer_reviews.text: The arch mouse is definitely something different. It comes with a USB transceiver to use the mouse wirelessly. I am using this mouse to travel with in my laptop case. When you are storing it, you un-arch-it so it lays flat. To use it, flexit in a curve, or archit. The design takes a little bit getting used to. The way it fits in your hand is not what you normally have with a standard mouse. I have used it many times and in very happy with it. To use with my laptop when traveling it is just fine. I have had people notice its design and ask what it is which makes me smile. Happy that I bought it
customer_reviews.author: CJ Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Scroling stops working randomly
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers note, the scroll function just stops working randomly. You need to flatten and re-arc the mouse to get it working again. The frequency with which this happens seems to increase with age. Finally after about 3 years mine started malfunctioning in all sorts of ways. It's an interesting concept, but I'm not sure it really provides much advantage over a small laptop mouse for travel--neither is particularly ergonomic. And, I've never had the scroll wheel on a normal mouse stop working. As Microsoft never acknowledged this as a software or hardware product defect, I won't be buying the "newer version".

customer_reviews.title: I love this mouse!

I decided to buy another one for my computer at work as well. After having 3 of these I can tell you that they work wonderfully and I haven't had a single problem out of any of them. I absolutely love the grip and accuracy of them. I also love how they are so easy to pack up and take with you when traveling.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage Microsoft should be ashamed

The solution is either to keep the nails short, or to scroll with your fingers slightly turned sideways, that is not always comfortable.

It's not like an advanced mouse because I could not locate a button to go forward and backward in web pages for example but it scrolls incredibly well. Probably the easiest mouse to use on an Adobe document. I recommend you try this mouse. I do understand that this isn't the right mouse for every person.

customer_reviews.title: shoddy manufacturing of the mouse
customer_reviews.text: I have had three of arc touch mouse. The first lasted a year, the second 6 months and the lastest and last mouse broke after a month. I am a casual computer user so this is not a device that is being worn out from use. It is very poorly constructed. You ask why would I buy three - I love the fit in my hand but my patience, budget and comfort of the device have run dry. I would definitely not recommend this product.

customer_reviews.title: I expected much more from this mouse. The buttons ...
customer_reviews.text: I expected much more from this mouse. The buttons are far too stiff for prolonged used, and the mouse "wheel" is unusable. I can scroll down using the "wheel", but scrolling up doesn't work -- as soon as I lift my finger, the browser page or document snaps back to where the scrolling started. The mouse also has problems tracking on some spots of my office desk. From looking at those spots, I can't really see any difference in reflectivity or texture, but the mouse cursor consistently stutters when the mouse is over them.
customer_reviews.author: T Hoff

customer_reviews.title: Good product once the scrolling sound is turned off

Carrying a regular size mouse in addition to a notebook and laptop is clunky. I love the design for that purpose. Note that the mouse comes programmed with a very annoying noise on the scroll function. Why Microsoft would add this as a standard setting is beyond me. Not only is it annoying if I am working my myself, but is unacceptable in a group setting working next to others. After about an hour of searching online I was able to find the Microsoft software to download that let me turn that silly noise function off!

Battery life is good, with a pair of AAA batteries lasting for months. I have had no connection issues. These mice are slightly more expensive than I would prefer but they are responsive, comfortable, and very cool looking. Definitely a great accessory for my Surface devices.

customer_reviews.title: Cursor/pointer not responding
customer_reviews.text: Will be returning. I recieved my mouse and plugged the USB receiver into my Dell Latitude work laptop the next morning- it worked fine for all of about 2 minutes then completely stopped responding. I tried new batteries, different ports even a different computer- all to no avail. Both computers recognize the mouse as "ready to use" but no cursor/pointer response- it seems as if the mouse is not connecting to the USB receiver at all. There are only very generic troubleshooting hints on the Microsoft site and the forums are full of posts from users with similar issues and no knowledgeable help from Microsoft.

customer_reviews.title: Graceful Design

There is something more practical about the roller wheel. Albeit, this has very clean lines and aesthetically pleasing shape. Worth the price just for those considerations.

This one WILL track on granite.

The buttons are a little stiffer compared to other mice, while the middle button is a neat touch pad that feels natural and responds with haptic feedback and noise. The dongle is innocuous to stay plugged into the laptop, and the little flip turns the mouse off to slip into the bag. Home or away this is my mouse of choice.

customer_reviews.text: I really like having a mouse that folds flat, as it is one less thing to hold when moving around the office. 3 things I don't like 1. At times it seems to 'disconnect' moving the mouse doesn't move the pointer. hitting the trackpad on my laptop or turning off/on the mouse fixes it. 3. The scroll wheel sometimes stops working, but a quick, off/on fixes the issue. Those 3 things don't bother me at all, and I doubt everyone's mouse does that.

It just takes a slit second to do this but it's an annoyance. Also annoying it that the slick black plastic on the buttons shows fingerprints really bad. But- no big deal, I guess. Where it becomes a 4-5 star mouse is when you travel with it. Fold it flat and it shuts off....slides into any briefcase beautifully. Pop it out, bend it into shape and boom....you have a very nice mobile mouse.
customer_reviews.author: C. Frame

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product engineering, but the tracking sucks
customer_reviews.text: It is extremely slim when flattened, and much more comfortable when upright than other travel mice. The primary and secondary buttons have a decent resistance that makes them click easily but intentionally, and the scroll "wheel" feels great. The receiver is tiny, and the magnet in the mouse is strong enough that bumping the receiver off on accident is almost impossible. So why only two stars? Because the mouse stops moving the cursor every few minutes in the middle of a stroke, and refuses to pick up again until I hold it perfectly still for a second or two. I've tried it on multiple surfaces, multiple computers, and with multiple people. Same results every time.

customer_reviews.text: I bought this to pair with my Surface Pro 3. I love it. It definitely took a while to get used to though, mainly because the shape is so different than a normal mouse. When necessary, I just unplug the dongle, stick it to the back of the mouse, and away I go. The only slight negative is that if the haptic scroll strip gets a little smudgy or dirty, it gets really wonky. But a quick wipe down and it's good to go.

customer_reviews.title: It's a great wireless mouse
customer_reviews.text: It's a great wireless mouse. I am a little disappointed that it wasn't Bluetooth enabled, but that was my own error when I was shopping for this mouse. It requires you to plug in the wireless USB plug, but it works flawlessly. The batteries last a very long time too. Very portable and very comfortable to use. But I do wish there was a way to "silence" the scroll wheel. Not sure how to do that if it is possible Oh, and this wasn't just good for my Surface Pro 3 and Pro 4, but it also works wonderfully with my Macbook Pro. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mouse for recliner chair arm material!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this in today, i have a tablet with usb-c connections and plugged this in using adapter and worked within seconds on windows 10. It starting working before i logged into windows. I wanted this since i use this tablet on my lap while sitting in my recliner and needed a mouse that works on crazy surfaces. Works perfect on recliner arm, just as good as normal mouse on normal desk. I recommend this completely. Well worth it
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: or just assumed that it was like the one I had before
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was completely Bluetooth no additional items needed. I use to have one that once you turned it on your laptop would recognize it via Bluetooth. This one comes with a nano receiver for you to plug into your laptop USB port. not sure if I read it wrong, or just assumed that it was like the one I had before.
customer_reviews.author: Kiser273

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely not your typical mouse. It does not fit in your hand like most of the mice you’ll of experienced. And I found it it was a little bit of a learning curve, especially with the scrolling wheel. But once I got used to it, I have been really happy with it. I use it with a Microsoft surface six and I really like how compactly it stores and travels. It is a little strange to be actually bend a piece of equipment to turn it on, but I am now very confident in it’s mechanical and electronic reliability.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Pelchat

customer_reviews.title: Great form factor, poor connectivity
customer_reviews.text: I love the slim form factor but my mouse seems to lose connection occasionally and it reconnect about 15 seconds later. I have fresh batteries in it, and I am not sure if it is the unit itself that is malfunctioning or interference around it. The functionality of the on/off (bending and straightening) is great for the traveler and battery life. I will give this some more time to use it and update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: TheHoskins12

customer_reviews.title: Great product when it works
customer_reviews.text: Nice design, bit smaller that expected but practical for travel. Finger marks on mouse tips can be avoided with plastic protection cover, I used simple scotch tape, looks nice. Working fine so far, update if any issues in the future. UPDATE: Mouse lose connection with laptop once per day, for no reason whatsoever. Downgrading from 5 to 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Milan Che

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, Comfortable, and VERY Functional!
customer_reviews.text: Only had it for a few weeks now, but I LOVE it. It's attractive, comfortable, and very functional. I love that simply by "clicking" it out flat, it turns off. A great energy saver. I actually LIKE that the USB dongle "stores" via a magnet on the underside of the mouse. However, I do agree that it could very easily be lost. Not a major for me (or most others I imagine) as I just leave the dongle plugged into my laptop for transport, as it's so low-profile you practically forget it's there. Great mouse! I anticipate I will love it for quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: clillies92

customer_reviews.title: I like that it collapses flat for easy travel
customer_reviews.text: Pros: I like that it collapses flat for easy travel. The precision and response are good, as are the two main buttons. Cons: the center touch pads that act as the mouse wheel are the reason for the 3-star review. They are not consistent in their behavior and sometimes quit working altogether until I turn the mouse of and on again. Summary: This works fine as a mouse for travel, but I wouldn't want it for everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Carey

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Could definitely be more responsive than it is on the center touch scroll 'wheel'.. I would recommend spending the extra few bucks and going with the blue tooth version of this, at least there won't be a little receiver piece to keep tabs on. I have lost that little guy more times than I care to count, since I use it on the Surface Pro 3 (which has only 1 USB port), thankfully I always seem to get lucky and find it. But the extra $10 for the blue tooth version, would have definitely been worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe C

customer_reviews.title: Best Mouse EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is amazing! I work in an office and have to carry around a laptop everywhere, I hate, no loath the touchpad on any laptop and i was always stuck carrying around a bulky cordless mouse (whose batteries always died). Now with this mouse - it flattens out and fits nicely into my pocket! A huge unexpected bonus is that it automatically shuts off when you flatten it out. Gone are the days of blowing through batteries! The shape of the mouse took some getting use too, but overall I like the feel of it. It also seems to be really well constructed. If this ever breaks, I will purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Coleman

customer_reviews.title: note before you buy, it will eventullay stop working.like mine. and you can buy the replacement!!
customer_reviews.text: This stopped working after about 8 month!!! but i really loved it while i was using it. if this was other seller, i would give 5 star. but come on mircrosoft!! you don't sell parts and still your mouse breaks, i have full battery and fully functioning non damaged mouse, suddenly it starts to become really frezzy and stopped working completely!!
customer_reviews.author: Verified True Feed Back

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: I bought the mouse for its portability. In that sense, it's great. The receiver is small, and the mouse is light and doesn't take up much space. As a mouse, it kind of sucks. I never use it for long, but the mouse's odd shape would be uncomfortable to use for extended periods. The scroll pad looks cool but functionally, it's not that great. Sometimes it's unresponsive and I have to turn it off and on again. Your hand has to be clean and dry, otherwise it doesn't work well. I don't think it's as accurate as a regular scroll wheel. I wouldn't recommend this mouse. I think a small laptop mouse would have been better.
customer_reviews.author: Falafel

customer_reviews.title: disappointment
customer_reviews.text: The touch scrolling is a cool idea. I ended up disappointed with this mouse. The biggest reason is NO dedicated back button. You can set a tap button in the middle of the scrolling "pad" for this. Most times I had to tap it 2-4 times to get it to work when I wanted to go back and when I was scrolling it would work when I didn't want it to. Very frustrating. The mouse worked good other then that- smooth movement and no lag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and effective mouse
customer_reviews.text: I prefer this wireless mouse over my laptop trackpad and it’s the perfect tool. While it’s not the most ergonomic, it is small, lightweight and has a long battery life (owned for 4 months and haven’t needed to replace the battery yet).
customer_reviews.author: Picabolab

customer_reviews.title: Cool form factor but ultimately does not work consistently.
customer_reviews.text: I have to cycle the power (remove and reinsert batteries) on the mouse daily because it loses its connection to my computer and stops working. The scroll feature also suddenly stops working every few days. Also, the responsiveness becomes janky every few days, which I am able to resolve by unplugging and replugging the USB sensor. Another major feature missing from this mouse is backwards and forwards buttons. I am going to see if I can return this to Amazon.com for a full refund and go back to a wired mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Most others are better.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. The first one was constantly glitching out on me. The scrolling would stick or not work at all. All the buttons would stick. The scrolling would try to catch up with my actions but then over scroll. I would have to turn off and then back on in order to get functionality back. I returned the item as defective and a replacement was sent. The replacement is 75% better than the first one, but still glitches out here and there. My $7 Logitech is more reliable than this Arc Touch Mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Harley Barbie

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and functions very well
customer_reviews.text: SUCH an upgrade from my previous travel mouse. Comfortable and functions very well. Magnet on the bottom to carry the usb part is great. Update: Piece of junk. After a month of light use, the scroll wheel thing works less than 1/2 the time. I can't see what's wrong with it. It doesn't ever feel "stuck" or anything, it just won't work. Super frustrating. I've gone back to using my old travel mouse that is uncomfortable after long use but the wheel works
customer_reviews.author: Korry Scott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Travel
customer_reviews.text: This is truly the best mouse for traveling. Folds flat and takes up very little space. Works every time, just like I expect it to.
customer_reviews.author: R Carr

customer_reviews.title: Mouse keeps freezing--ANNOYING!!!!
customer_reviews.text: BOOO! I love this item--WHEN IT WORKS...which is intermittently. The mouse will just freeze and then I have to shut down my computer and restart. This is happening a few times per day. . It makes me lose my mind. AND....Amazon won't take it back. Double, triple and quadruple boo!! Can't stand that neither Amazon nor Microsoft will stand behind this product.
customer_reviews.author: JP Cooks in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Look Closely Before Buying!
customer_reviews.text: This is a transceiver-based product, not BlueTooth. It requires a dongle to be inserted in the USB port. However, there is no convenient place to store the dongle when not in use. Also, the mouse makes an annoying sound when scrolling. I've explored multiple ways to silence this. Nothing works so far.
customer_reviews.author: VW

customer_reviews.title: PART FALLS OFF - 2nd one with this issue
customer_reviews.text: There is a hard plastic piece at the base of the mouse that allows it to slide easily. I have this mouse in grey and in black and now can't use either of them. That part fell off on both causing the movement to just grab/stick. I looked at a lot of conversations on Microsoft's community site of other people with the same issue NOT being able to get help or get replacement parts. I HIGHLY recommend for this price, you just skip it and try a different one. So disappointing as I really liked everything else about it.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline Toft

customer_reviews.title: Faulty hardware
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews, seemed like a good buy. I love the design, but ultimately it's unusable. Every few seconds or so it simply freezes in place, and a few seconds later will return to normal. Makes basically every function frustrating. Apparently this was a pretty common issue and Microsoft still has yet to fix it. I tested it on a Surface Pro 3 running Windows 8.1 and my laptop with Windows 10, neither one solved the issue. I've used both Microsoft's drivers and generic ones, still a problem.
customer_reviews.author: SteelerfaninPeru

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Worth what you are paying for but look for better priced similar item
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the bluetooth option
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is constantly disconnecting and reconnecting to my Microsoft surface pro. I'm not sure if it's the computer or mouse but it gets very annoying when I'm working. The USB mouse does not come close to the quality of the buthtooth one. I had a bluetooth one and I broke it and should got the same to replace it instead of saving a few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Ronan

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: You can use it on a glassy surface, but it works better on something lightly textured. Having trouble with the scroll feature and I have to have my fingers low on the buttons to get them to click properly. I guess my hands are a bit too small. I can flatten it out and put it in my pencil case or pocket when I'm on the go. I have another Microsoft mouse that I've had since '98 and it works wonderfully well to this day. I would buy this Arc mouse again, but I hope it's as good as the other, and I don't need to for a long time to come.
customer_reviews.author: Silent Bear

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The design is great however the response rate from the mouse to USB is very poor. There is significant delay. The mouse scroll experienced the same issue, and at time becomes nonreponsive. This is not an item to recommend for the advance user but rather for a very low end user. I would not recommend this product. There are many other microsoft mouse at lower prices that perform much better.
customer_reviews.author: Code7

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this mouse to be all it was advertised as but unfortunately it's not. One of the features I really liked was the scroll feature but it does not work properly most of the time. Plus the unit does strange things likes just stops working for short periods of time. I really thought Microsoft would have produced a better product before they released it to the market. Several other reviews are say they are having the same problems so I know this is not an isolated problem.
customer_reviews.author: Lamar Steen

customer_reviews.title: Not bluetooth and you can loose the dongle - no dongle replacements available.
customer_reviews.text: This uses a Microsoft Nano Transceiver v1.0. It is not bluetooth. You must plug in the dongle into a USB port. The dongle looks exactly like a Bluetooth dongle or a wifi dongle. None of which have distinguishing identifiers so you can't find it. If you loose it you can't get another transceiver, instead you must buy another mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Greg-o

customer_reviews.title: Love the design, but unable to use.
customer_reviews.text: I love the design of the mouse. The left/right clicks are ok. You will need to use some pressure to make the button work, and the scroll is cool. It is a touch scroll that have a vibration to make it feel like you are using a regular scroll. It is unfortunate that Amazon sold me a bad product. I did not get to use it with my PC since the USB dongle is bad. So my review is based on getting my hands on the mouse itself but did not get to use the product fully with a PC.
customer_reviews.author: N. Ngo

customer_reviews.title: My mistake
customer_reviews.text: Did not read advertisement. Thought it was just like my old (Bluetooth). My surprise when it came and I opened it up. I then read description and realized I picked the wrong one. Takes up USB port 2.4 ghx wireless.
customer_reviews.author: ESF

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Convenient!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this mouse. You will either love it or hate it. One of my coworkers did not like the shape and feel. This works great for me and I love how compact it is. I love using it for presentations, I can just hold the mouse in my hand and click to move to the next slide. I haven't figured out how to go back to the previous slide though. This works great for business travel! My husband also borrowed this for a presentation and also loved it. It is guaranteed to spark up a conversation!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Close to the original but glitchy
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these that lasted almost 8 years and then it started to get a little glitchy. I was super impressed with its performance for 8 years so I decided to get another one only to find out they're a little less quality than they used to be, but the price has stayed the same. Just know that once in a while some of the functions may turn off so you need to turn the mouse off and restart it to get all the functions back.
customer_reviews.author: V. C. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Most Innovative - Changed from ("uncomfortable")
customer_reviews.text: 5/11 Updating my review. Arc Touch which was returned to me sat in the closet for 3 months until this month when I gave this one to a techy, he was using win8.1 on a X1-carbon touch. He just loved it, all the functionality & style and it offers. Rating changed! 2/10 I ordered two of these and a MS Sculpt Comfort Mouse (H3S-00003), both of the employees who were given Arc Touch mouse returned the mouse back to me and they complained issues with her wrist while using it. One of the user also mentioned that it doesn't move really smooth on the desk.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: I'm a Big Fan of this mouse!!
customer_reviews.text: After mistakenly purchasing the usb version, I was able to easily return it and purchase the Bluetooth version. It works great and feels good too. I use this with my Surface Pro, and it works great. I initially had purchased the wedge mouse which was also Bluetooth, but the fact that the on/off was on the bottom of the mouse, every time I would throw it in my bag, it would get turned on and the batteries would die. With the arc, it's much more difficult for it to be turned on, because you have to lock in in the arc position before it turns on. I would definitely recommend this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: David Marsh

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect solution for that
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a mouse that I can tuck into my pocket while in transit to meetings at work and works on any surface. This is the perfect solution for that. When I collapse it, it turns off the power, too. I have been looking for a dependable mouse for home use as well and have had trouble finding one that works on a variety of surfaces, and this is what I chose. Previously, I had tried a Logitech M330, but its pointer movement was erratic. While the Microsoft RVF-00052 Arc Touch Mouse is more expensive, it is so more versatile and dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C.

customer_reviews.title: Scroll wheel makes me avoid using it.
customer_reviews.text: I agree with the others that the form is beautiful, but the scroll wheel is impossible. If I could send it back, I would. I have an older version of the Microsoft mouse that I thought I would replace with this newer sleeker one. Instead, I keep this one to the side and use the older mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Disposable Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Very nice mouse, if you don't need a center button. Unfortunately the gadgety on/off mechanism wears out. Mine lasted about three years. Now it won't turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: ... 5 years now and can say this is the best mouse i've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for 5 years now and can say this is the best mouse i've ever owned. I'm a consultant and travel a bunch, it has a slim profile and i've changed the battery probably once a year. It works like a champ and still feels rugged and works on more surfaces than most mice i've used!
customer_reviews.author: Vishal Pachigar

customer_reviews.title: Sleek mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Microsoft Arc mouse I have owned. When I worked it was great for travel, but it is the most comfortable, ergonomic mouse that I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked real well until...
customer_reviews.text: Worked real well until... IT BROKE! Im not sure what happened. I never abused or misused it. It internally fell apart when I "unarced" it about 3 months after the purchase. The good thing is that the nice people at Microsoft replaced it free of charge. Only had to pay shipping charges out of pocket. The replacement has worked great so far. Super portable and words great with my apple laptop as well as my non-apple laptops. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft quality and convenience
customer_reviews.text: Compact and convenient. Precise without delay in responsiveness. Powers off when straightened out. Good option with USB plug in making it versatile and can be used with other laptops.
customer_reviews.author: A Particular Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Mighty Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is a small, powerful, easy to use mouse! My wife doesn’t like the noise it makes when you scroll down quickly but it doesn’t bother me. It gives my hands a break from the tracker on my laptop!
customer_reviews.author: Yvee22

customer_reviews.title: works great. I don't like the artificial wheel scroll sound/vibration ...
customer_reviews.text: works great. I don't like the artificial wheel scroll sound/vibration effect, but is easily configured with the Microsoft driver. Use this for travel and is a great alternate to other small-size or full size mice for keeping in my laptop bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

Feel the speed and responsiveness to your touch.
